Legal_Issue: Reasonableness and procedural fairness of citizenship judge's decision
Application_Facts: Dr. Abdelhamid claimed 1095 days of physical presence in Canada; discrepancies found between his records and ICES data
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the citizenship judge's decision
Defendant_Behavior: Citizenship Judge applied residency requirements and assessed evidence
Grounds_for_Claim: Dispute over fulfillment of residency requirement and alleged procedural unfairness
Assessment_Factor: Credibility of applicant's evidence, consistency with official records
Procedural_Issue: Alleged failure to consider all submitted documents
Credibility_Assessment: Judge found inconsistencies and missing evidence affecting credibility
Legal_Provision_Cited: Requirement of 1095 days of physical presence over four years
Application_Basis: Failure to prove physical residency as required by law
Evidence_Assessed: Records submitted by Dr. Abdelhamid and ICES data
Governing_Rule: Burden on applicant to prove residency; procedural fairness requires consideration of material evidence
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Missing and inconsistent evidence regarding physical presence
Harm_Assessment: No demonstrable harm due to lack of material procedural unfairness
Cause_Description: Dispute over residency requirement fulfillment and procedural fairness during citizenship application process
Evidence_Handling: Unconsidered documents deemed immaterial to substantiating residency claim
Legal_Provision_Violated: Section of Citizenship Act regarding physical presence requirement
Evidence_Issues: Inconsistencies between applicant’s documentation and government records
Residency_Compliance: Not satisfied – unable to verify 1095 days of physical presence
Misrepresentation_Element: Potential inaccuracies in residency claims, though not explicitly ruled as intentional
Legal_Provision: Citizenship Act – Residency requirement (1095 days in four years)
Evidence_Assessment: Judge determined evidence insufficient to verify residency
Decision_Rationale: Inability to verify physical presence due to inconsistencies and gaps in evidence; no material procedural unfairness
Evidentiary_Issues: Discrepancies between self-reported data and ICES records, lack of corroborating evidence
